round_best: Develop an adaptive AI simulation model that dynamically alternates between Rawlsian and utilitarian policy frameworks based on real-time data analysis of social welfare indicators. This model would use machine learning to predict short-term and long-term outcomes of various policy decisions, automatically adjusting its policy recommendation strategy to optimize both immediate and future welfare. The system could also incorporate feedback loops where policies are continually refined as new data becomes available, ensuring a balanced approach that provides equitable relief when necessary while maximizing overall welfare gains in the long run.
